attribute-definition.description: Renders an alternative URL in main navigation. Uses demandware content url notation. For example: $url('Account-Show')$ or normal urls http://xchange.demandware.com

Used to define the content asset used to populate a grid page banner for a category. This value is applied to all sub category navigation (cascading) if no specific catBannerID has been defined for a sub category.
Use this attribute to apply custom styles for this category.

ONLY for form information.
This field is used instead "Name" if filled (completed)

ONLY for form information.
This field is used instead "Name" if filled (completed)

Used to define if/when the Compare feature is to be visualized in the storefront based on navigation. If enableCompare = FALSE, no Compare checkboxes will be displayed in the grid view. If enableCompare = TRUE, the category (and its children) will support the Compare feature.
Which way to orient the menu and optional header menu HTML. Vertical will list all in one line. Horizontal will list in columns.
Determines whether or not to display the product ID/SKU in the product tile for a category

Used to indicate that a category (such as Mens -> Footwear -> Boots) will display in the roll over navigation. A sub-category only shows if also the parent category is marked as showInMenu. Up to three category levels are shown in roll over navigation.

Used to define the content asset ID of the Size Chart that is appropriate for products whose PRIMARY category is the associated category (and its children). Whenever a product detail page (or quick view) is rendered, the Size Chart link is populated based on the value of this attribute for the products primary categorization. If not defined, NO size chart link is displayed.

This is a JSON mapping table between the brand file name (which is also the value in the brand attribute of the product) and the actual brand name (which may contain special characters, etc.)
Semi colon separated list

This preference value is expected to be a valid client-side javascript. In the event that BV Q&A are displayed behind a tab, this javascript will be used by BV to open the tab in the event that the "Read all Q&A" link is clicked by an end user.
All notifications for BV-related DW job schedules will be sent to this email address.

With BV Hosted authentication method, users click the "write a review" link on a product page and authenticate by using just their email address provided in content submission page. With DW Site authentication, users are redirected to login to the DW site before the user can access the BV submission page.
SEO Cloud key value as defined in your BV platform account. This key is only required if Cloud SEO is enabled.
Client Name as defined in your BV platform account
Deployment Zone Name as defined in your BV platform account
Turn on BV Questions & Answers. This will enable display of Q&A content on your product pages. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.

Turn on the BV SEO solution. This will include SEO-friendly content (located in the BV SEO cloud) in your product pages. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.

Turn on BV JS-based inline ratings. This will enable display of product rating statistics on your category and search results pages. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.

Turn on Product Feed generation. This will enable generation of a product feed to be sent to the BV FTP server. See documentation for additional steps to setup a scheduled job in DW for this feature to take effect.

Turn on Purchase Feed generation. This will enable generation of a purchase feed to be sent to the BV FTP server to be used to send post-interaction emails to your customers in order to solicit review submission. See documentation for additional steps to setup a scheduled job in DW for this feature to take effect.
Turn on the BV ROI beacon tag on the DW purchase transaction (checkout) page. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.
Turn on BV Ratings & Reviews. This will enable display of R&R content on your product pages. See documentation for additional steps that must be completed for this feature to take effect.
Key used to encode BV user authentication string. Only required when DW Site Authentication is selected. Defined in your BV platform account.
BV environment that this DW instance type is integrating with
Password used to access the BV FTP server for feed upload/download processes.
FtP Client timeout in milliseconds

Colon separated value pairs that define how DW Locales are mapped to BV Locales. DW Locales must be enabled in the current DW Site. BV Locales must be enabled within your BV platform acocunt. Format: ["(DW Locale ID)":]"(BV Locale)"

This is the Image Size type used in the feed. The value must match an existing Image Size type. If Image Type custom site preference is set to anything other than medium, then when the feed generator discovers a product that does not have that size type defined, the medium image will be used. If no medium image is set for that product, no image URL will be added in the feed

This is the Image Size type used in the feed. The value must match an existing Image Size type. If Image Type custom site preference is set to anything other than medium, then when the feed generator discovers a product that does not have that size type defined, the medium image will be used. If no medium image is set for that product, no image URL will be added in the feed
This determines whether to use the purchase date or ship date when calculating which purchases to include in the purchase feed.

attribute-definition.display-name: Show Reviews Tab Javascript function (product page)
attribute-definition.description: This preference value is expected to be a valid client-side javascript. In the event that Bazaarvoice reviews are displayed behind a tab, this javascript will be used by Bazaarvoice to open the tab in the event that the "Read all reviews" link is clicked by an end user.
When true, this causes a TLS check to take place based on whether or not a cookie ('dw_TLSWarning') has been set on the browser
Default Country Code for Store Searches
Preauthorization: 0 passed in request Final authorization: 1 passed in request Undefined authorization:omit authIndicator field from the request message
To receive email from customer. ex. Fakes & Counterfeit etc.
The Visa Checkout account API key specified in cyberSource business center (Alphanumeric; maximum 100 characters)
The color of the Visa Checkout button standard (default) neutral
Height of the button, in pixels, You must specify the height if you specify a value for width 34 47 94
Sandbox https://sandbox.secure.checkout.visa.com/wallet-services-web/xo/button.png LIVE https://secure.checkout.visa.com/wallet-services-web/xo/button.png

attribute-definition.display-name: CyberSource Visa Button display on minicart and cart
attribute-definition.description: CyberSource Visa Button display on minicart and cart

You can either specify size to display a standard size button, or you can specify height and width to specify a custom size. If you do not specify size or both height and width, the button size is 213 pixels. If you specify height or width, the value of size is ignored 154 - small 213 - medium (default) 425 - High resolution or large

Width of the button, in pixels, You must specify the width if you specify a value for height -less than 477 if height is 34; default value is 154 -greater than 212 and less than 659 if height is 47; default value is 213 -greater than 424 and less than 1317 if height is 94; default value is 425

Override value for brands associated with card art to be displayed. If a brand matching the consumer's preferred card is specified, the card art is displayed on the button; otherwise, a generic button is displayed Select multiple ire required VISA MASTERCARD AMEX DISCOVER

Use profile's name, created externally by a merchant whom Visa Checkout uses to populate settings, such as accepted card brands and shipping regions. The properties set in this profile override properties in the merchant's current profile. (Alphanumeric; maximum 50 characters)

Sandbox https://sandbox-assets.secure.checkout.visa.com/checkout-widget/resources/js/integration/v1/sdk.js LIVE https://assets.secure.checkout.visa.com/checkout-widget/resources/js/integration/v1/sdk.js
The secret key specified VISA Checkout account profile
Indicate whether Tell Me More Link to be displayed with VISA button true (default) false

Whether Verified by Visa (VbV) is active for this transaction. If Verified by Visa is configured, you can use threeDSActive to deactivate it for the transaction; otherwise, VbV will be active if it has been configured

Whether a Verified by Visa (VbV) consumer authentication prompt is suppressed for this transaction. If true, VbV authentication is performed only when it is possible to do so without the consumer prompt. true - Do not display a consumer prompt. false - Allow a consumer prompt

To enable Enhanced Search Suggestions set this site preference to True and set the Search Preferences>Search Suggestion Settings > Search Suggestions option to Enabled. To enable the older version of search suggestions, set this site preference to False and set the Search Preferences>Search Suggestion Settings > Search Suggestions option to Enabled. The Search Preferences>Search Suggestion option is set to Disabled by default.
